title: How to end creative writing - Quora

response.answer_text: You end at the beginning. Huh? Before you start writing your story, you must have a clear view of how the book will end. Why? Because that is where the main character must wind up. If your main character doesn't have a clue as to what's going on, neither will your reader. Now, make sure you have a hook. What's that? A hook is simply a sentence or two placed in the first few pages of a novel or the first page of a short story that points directly to the last chapter. It is what motivates the main character to move ahead. Examples of hooks: “Gosh,Bob, this looks like a treasure map!” “Your mission, Mr. Bond, is to…” “Unless we can get $5000 by next Friday, Mommy's gonna lose the house.”

Before asking how to end,ask yourself in the first place the following: Why did your writing start?Is it to satisfy a character’s dream or is it a quest or mission to find something?What is that driving your main character?With these basic questions you may able to end the writing. Thank you.

Thank you for the A2A. Tell the outcome, positive or negative. There are definite conclusions, even though nothing external has changed: There sat the two grown-up persons; grown-up, and yet children; children at least in heart; and it was summer-time; summer, glorious summer! Gee-…. I could tell that one was a doozy. There are also conclusions which try to wrap everything up. He loved Big Brother. Gertrude and Ronald were wed. Their happiness was complete. Need we say more? Yes, only this. The Earl was killed in the hunting-field a few days after. The Countess was struck by lightning. The two children fell down a well. Thus the happiness of Gertrude and Ronald was complete.
